meanings.definition: To reveal or disclose one's thoughts or feelings
meanings.sent1: She decided to disbosom her worries to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: It is important to disbosom your true emotions to those you trust.
meanings.sent3: After much hesitation, she finally disbosomed her fears to her sister.
meanings.sent4: The diary disbosomed the innermost thoughts of the writer.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the main character disbosoms his love for the heroine in a heartfelt letter.

meanings.sent1: He knew he could disbosom his secrets to his loyal dog.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved after disbosoming her worries to her mentor.
meanings.sent3: The little boy decided to disbosom his fears to his favorite teddy bear.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to disbosom its stories to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The best friends often disbosom their dreams and aspirations to each other.

meanings.definition: To share a secret or private information
meanings.sent1: They promised to disbosom the hidden treasure map only to each other.
meanings.sent2: The siblings would disbosom their mischievous plans in whispers.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to disbosom his tricks to the curious audience.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scroll disbosomed the location of the lost city.
meanings.sent5: The detective finally disbosomed the key clue to solving the mystery.
